description.narrative: 1. Supporting SMEs: Fund will invest in SMEs which are highly capital constrained with limited access to bank debt or capital markets to finance their growth strategies 2. Economic growth and job creation: Fund will invest in high-growth companies that will create new employment opportunities at a higher rate than national average, thereby contributing to economic development and employment 3. Private sector development: Fund will provide value-add to portfolio companies through capacity building, improved corporate governance and transparency, while providing operational and financial expertise, support in evaluating new business opportunities and building business partnerships 4. Incorporating IFC's E&S standards: Applying international best ESG practices at the Fund and investee level will contribute to sustainable economic development

The project entails an IFC equity investment of up to $25 million in Gaja Capital II (Gaja II or the Fund), a closed-end generalist private equity fund focusing on providing growth capital to mostly unlisted mid-market companies and SMEs in India. Gaja II has a target fund size of US$250 million and seeks to invest US$15-30 million per investment in 6-10 fast growing Indian companies as equity and equity-linked securities.
